hero.heading:
GET AN

INTERVENTION
hero.text: Showing greater respect to older adults can be done in several ways: acknowledging and putting to use the talents and skills of older adults; creating intergenerational initiatives; and allowing older adults to stay active and independent for as long as possible.

understand.heading: WE UNDERSTAND
understand.text1: Older adults want to play active and meaningful roles in their lives, including as part of a social network, a neighborhood, and a community. Service providers and policymakers must consider that a lack of sense of purpose can become problematic as people age. Engaging them in leisure activities and volunteer work is important.
understand.text2: Older adults want to stay active and contribute to society in a reciprocal manner (meaning that they want to exchange their services and skills with others for the mutual benefit of the neighborhood or community). Qualitative and quantitative studies published from 2005 to 2016 examining the social needs of older adults were eligible for inclusion.
understand.text3: Qualitative and quantitative studies published from 2005 to 2016 examining the social needs of older adults were eligible for inclusion. To stimulate social contacts, neighborhood initiatives can be developed. Social meeting places, such as pubs and churches can help to foster the development of close and peripheral relationships.
understand.mobile_text1:
Older adults want to play active and meaningful roles in their lives, including as part of a social network, a neighborhood, and a community. Service providers and policymakers must consider that a lack of sense of purpose can become problematic as people age. Engaging them in leisure activities and volunteer work is important.

Older adults want to stay active and contribute to society in a reciprocal manner (meaning that they want to exchange their services and skills with others for the mutual benefit of the neighborhood or community).
understand.mobile_text2: Qualitative and quantitative studies published from 2005 to 2016 examining the social needs of older adults were eligible for inclusion. To stimulate social contacts, neighborhood initiatives can be developed. Social meeting places, such as pubs and churches can help to foster the development of close and peripheral relationships.

slider.name: Abbie Harvey
slider.text: I have been caring for my mom & dad off and on for about 10 years now, and I know the importance of me being there for appointments. Older people need attention, love and care that they truly deserve.

slider.name: Harry Arms
slider.text: I have been caring for my mom & dad off and on for about 10 years now, and I know the importance of me being there for appointments. Older people need attention, love and care that they truly deserve.

organize.heading: WE CAN ORGANIZE EVERYTHING
organize.interventions: Interventions should focus on older adult’s desire for connectedness, participation and independence.
organize.loneliness: Loneliness and social isolation are growing public health concerns in our aging society. Whilst these experiences occur across the life span, 50% of individuals aged over 60 are at risk of social isolation and one-third will experience some degree of loneliness later in life. It is vital to reduce loneliness and social isolation among older adults.
organize.methodology: The methodology framework proposed by Asked and O’Malley and further developed by Levac, et al. was used to guide the scoping review process. A total of 33 reviews met the inclusion criteria, evaluating a range of interventions targeted at older people residing in the community or institutionalised settings.

services.tooltip1: We assess the specific needs of older adults to ensure they receive the right support.
services.tooltip2: We create tailored treatment plans and assist with placement in appropriate care settings.
services.tooltip3: We arrange transportation and manage logistics to ensure seamless care delivery.
services.tooltip4: We’re experienced in our individual crafts and understand how each one of our roles impacts your plan holistically.
services.tooltip5: We advocate for employment opportunities that suit the capabilities of older adults.
services.tooltip6: We plan for ongoing care and support after initial interventions.

video.heading: WATCH THE VIDEO
video.service1_text: The Advocacy Evaluation Toolkit contains the instruments used to collect data for evaluating the Consumer Voices for Coverage program.
video.service2_text: We are committed to advocating for appropriate coverage and payment policies.
video.service3_text: Patients can better understand medical procedures, discharge instructions, etc.

thankyou.heading: Thank You!
thankyou.subheading: Your submission has been received successfully.
thankyou.message1: We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with your valuable information. Our team will review your submission and get back to you shortly.
thankyou.message2: In the meantime, feel free to explore our website or follow us on social media for updates and exciting offers.
